verses.verse: Better <S%H2896><s%> is the poor <S%H7326><s%> that walketh <S%H1980><s%> in his integrity <S%H8537><s%>, than he that is perverse <S%H6141><s%> in his lips <S%H8193><s%>, and is a fool <S%H3684><s%>.
Also, that the soul <S%H5315><s%> be without knowledge <S%H1847><s%>, it is not good <S%H2896><s%>; and he that hasteth <S%H213><s%> with his feet <S%H7272><s%> sinneth <S%H2398><s%>.
The foolishness <S%H200><s%> of man <S%H120><s%> perverteth <S%H5557><s%> his way <S%H1870><s%>: and his heart <S%H3820><s%> fretteth <S%H2196><s%> against the LORD <S%H3068><s%>.
Wealth <S%H1952><s%> maketh <S%H3254><s%> many <S%H7227><s%> friends <S%H7453><s%>; but the poor <S%H1800><s%> is separated <S%H6504><s%> from his neighbour <S%H7453><s%>.
A false <S%H8267><s%> witness <S%H5707><s%> shall not be unpunished <S%H5352><s%>, and he that speaketh <S%H6315><s%> lies <S%H3577><s%> shall not escape <S%H4422><s%>.
Many <S%H7227><s%> will intreat <S%H2470><s%> the favour <S%H6440><s%> of the prince <S%H5081><s%>: and every man is a friend <S%H7453><s%> to him <S%H376><s%> that giveth gifts <S%H4976><s%>.

All the brethren <S%H251><s%> of the poor <S%H7326><s%> do hate <S%H8130><s%> him: how much more do his friends <S%H4828><s%> go far <S%H7368><s%> from him? he pursueth <S%H7291><s%> them with words <S%H561><s%>, yet they are wanting to him.

He that getteth <S%H7069><s%> wisdom <S%H3820><s%> loveth <S%H157><s%> his own soul <S%H5315><s%>: he that keepeth <S%H8104><s%> understanding <S%H8394><s%> shall find <S%H4672><s%> good <S%H2896><s%>.
A false <S%H8267><s%> witness <S%H5707><s%> shall not be unpunished <S%H5352><s%>, and he that speaketh <S%H6315><s%> lies <S%H3577><s%> shall perish <S%H6><s%>.
Delight <S%H8588><s%> is not seemly <S%H5000><s%> for a fool <S%H3684><s%>; much less for a servant <S%H5650><s%> to have rule <S%H4910><s%> over princes <S%H8269><s%>.
The discretion <S%H7922><s%> of a man <S%H120><s%> deferreth <S%H748><s%> his anger <S%H639><s%>; and it is his glory <S%H8597><s%> to pass over <S%H5674><s%> a transgression <S%H6588><s%>.
The king's <S%H4428><s%> wrath <S%H2197><s%> is as the roaring <S%H5099><s%> of a lion <S%H3715><s%>; but his favour <S%H7522><s%> is as dew <S%H2919><s%> upon the grass <S%H6212><s%>.

A foolish <S%H3684><s%> son <S%H1121><s%> is the calamity <S%H1942><s%> of his father <S%H1><s%>: and the contentions <S%H4079><s%> of a wife <S%H802><s%> are a continual <S%H2956><s%> dropping <S%H1812><s%>.
House <S%H1004><s%> and riches <S%H1952><s%> are the inheritance <S%H5159><s%> of fathers <S%H1><s%>: and a prudent <S%H7919><s%> wife <S%H802><s%> is from the LORD <S%H3068><s%>.
Slothfulness <S%H6103><s%> casteth <S%H5307><s%> into a deep sleep <S%H8639><s%>; and an idle <S%H7423><s%> soul <S%H5315><s%> shall suffer hunger <S%H7456><s%>.
He that keepeth <S%H8104><s%> the commandment <S%H4687><s%> keepeth <S%H8104><s%> his own soul <S%H5315><s%>; but he that despiseth <S%H959><s%> his ways <S%H1870><s%> shall die <S%H4191><s%>.
He that hath pity <S%H2603><s%> upon the poor <S%H1800><s%> lendeth <S%H3867><s%> unto the LORD <S%H3068><s%>; and that which he hath given <S%H1576><s%> will he pay him again <S%H7999><s%>.
Chasten <S%H3256><s%> thy son <S%H1121><s%> while there is <S%H3426><s%> hope <S%H8615><s%>, and let not thy soul <S%H5315><s%> spare <S%H5375><s%> for his crying <S%H4191><s%>.
A man <S%H1419><s%> of great <S%H1632><s%> wrath <S%H2534><s%> shall suffer <S%H5375><s%> punishment <S%H6066><s%>: for if thou deliver <S%H5337><s%> him, yet thou must do it again <S%H3254><s%>.
Hear <S%H8085><s%> counsel <S%H6098><s%>, and receive <S%H6901><s%> instruction <S%H4148><s%>, that thou mayest be wise <S%H2449><s%> in thy latter end <S%H319><s%>.
There are many <S%H7227><s%> devices <S%H4284><s%> in a man's <S%H376><s%> heart <S%H3820><s%>; nevertheless the counsel <S%H6098><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%>, that shall stand <S%H6965><s%>.
The desire <S%H8378><s%> of a man <S%H120><s%> is his kindness <S%H2617><s%>: and a poor man <S%H7326><s%> is better <S%H2896><s%> than <S%H376><s%> a liar <S%H3577><s%>.

The fear <S%H3374><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> tendeth to life <S%H2416><s%>: and he that hath it shall abide <S%H3885><s%> satisfied <S%H7649><s%>; he shall not be visited <S%H6485><s%> with evil <S%H7451><s%>.
A slothful <S%H6102><s%> man hideth <S%H2934><s%> his hand <S%H3027><s%> in his bosom <S%H6747><s%>, and will not so much as bring <S%H7725><s%> it to his mouth <S%H6310><s%> again <S%H7725><s%>.

Smite <S%H5221><s%> a scorner <S%H3887><s%>, and the simple <S%H6612><s%> will beware <S%H6191><s%>: and reprove <S%H3198><s%> one that hath understanding <S%H995><s%>, and he will understand <S%H995><s%> knowledge <S%H1847><s%>.

He that wasteth <S%H7703><s%> his father <S%H1><s%>, and chaseth away <S%H1272><s%> his mother <S%H517><s%>, is a son <S%H1121><s%> that causeth shame <S%H954><s%>, and bringeth reproach <S%H2659><s%>.
Cease <S%H2308><s%>, my son <S%H1121><s%>, to hear <S%H8085><s%> the instruction <S%H4148><s%> that causeth to err <S%H7686><s%> from the words <S%H561><s%> of knowledge <S%H1847><s%>.
An ungodly <S%H1100><s%> witness <S%H5707><s%> scorneth <S%H3887><s%> judgment <S%H4941><s%>: and the mouth <S%H6310><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> devoureth <S%H1104><s%> iniquity <S%H205><s%>.
Judgments <S%H8201><s%> are prepared <S%H3559><s%> for scorners <S%H3887><s%>, and stripes <S%H4112><s%> for the back <S%H1460><s%> of fools <S%H3684><s%>.
